SEARCH
Package com.java.simonsobstaclecourse.view

Class GameView

java.lang.Object
com.java.simonsobstaclecourse.view.GameView
public class GameView extends Object
The GameView class is responsible for updating the graphical representation of the game board, displaying information such as the current player, dice values, top players, win messages, and handling user input through the command line interface.
Author:
Abhishek Wadmare, Lakshay Narula

    • updateBoard

      public void updateBoard(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gameBoard, Squares squares)
      Updates the graphical representation of the game board based on the provided Squares object.
      Parameters:
      gameBoard - The GridPane representing the game board.
      squares - The Squares object containing information about each square on the board.

    • updateTopPlayersList

      public void updateTopPlayersList(javafx.scene.control.ListView<String> topScore, List<Player> top10Players)
      Updates the top players list on the graphical user interface.
      Parameters:
      topScore - The ListView representing the top players list.
      top10Players - The list of top players to be displayed.

    • displayCurrentPlayer

      public void displayCurrentPlayer(Players players)
      Displays the current player on the console.
      Parameters:
      players - The Players object containing information about the players.

    • displayDice

      public void displayDice(int diceValue, javafx.scene.control.Label rollValue)
      Displays the dice value on the graphical user interface and on the console.
      Parameters:
      diceValue - The value rolled on the dice.
      rollValue - The Label representing the dice value on the GUI.

    • displayWinMessage

      public void displayWinMessage(Player player, javafx.scene.control.Label message)
      Displays a win message on the graphical user interface and on the console.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who won the game.
      message - The Label representing the win message on the GUI.
